intro: Astragalus polyacanthus, commonly known as the many-thorned milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense spikes, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Astragalus polyacanthus is known for its robust root system and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
